data.title: The Biggest Chart Singles 1979
data.meta_description: The biggest singles of 1979 based on their Chart-Measured Performance (CHAMP) totals. CHAMP is WOW's unique scoring system based on each single's weekly positions in both the official and NME charts.
data.text:
The UK's Top 40 best performing singles in 1979 are listed below. The two best selling singles of the year are also its best performing chart hits. I Will Survive by Gloria Gaynor (No. 5) is one of the biggest singles by a female solo artist during the Golden Years (1977-85). The Police (No. 16) and Queen (No. 20) appear in our year-end Top 20 for the first time, while ABBA make their third consecutive appearance in the Top 40, albeit far outside the top places (Nos. 34 and 38). They will be back on top in 1980.

Singles are ordered by their Chart Measured Performance (CHAMP) scores. A single's peak position and the month it peaked are also provided.

➀ – ➈ NME peak position (if different from official chart)
